values.name: Alchemical lubricants
values.description: Various wet things that keep machines running.
values.use: Popular with mechanomancers & engineers.

values.name: Beast egg masses
values.description: Fleshy, squishy, and fickle. Keep in cooled vats to prevent from spoiling.
values.use: Biomancers have advantage when growing these into new servitor creatures.

values.name: Bone-work
values.description: Moldable or editable chunks of raw bone, still warm with bone-sculpture.
values.use: Beloved of necromancers and bone wizards.

values.name: Chitin cap
values.description: Sheets and rods and fibres of chitin grown from the Umber fungoid bio-mantics. Once more common.
values.use: An important component of both buildings and autogolems.

values.name: Common intoxicants
values.description: Drugs like cat coffee (Violet City), felix whizz, and purple haze. Broadly tolerated, like tea is today.
values.use: Make life more tolerable for the poor and bereft. Often weakly addictive.

values.name: Cosmic scales
values.description: In different shapes and colours, iridescent and rare, there must be mines near the Dark City.
values.use: Rich Rainbowlanders craft suits and capes with them, twinkling as they go.

values.name: Dryland coral seeds
values.description: Incredibly vulnerable and have to be kept in sealed containers to protect them from the open air.
values.use: A valuable construction material, lets petromancers grow entire buildings.

values.name: Gems and jewels
values.description: Rare stones of ancient manufacture, rubies and sapphires and emeralds.
values.use: Great for focusing light and making illusions.

values.name: Gold
values.description: Red, white, or midnight blue. The demiurges gave this metal many hues.
values.use: It’s gold. Also useful for electromancers.

values.name: Indigo ivories
values.description: From the teeth of the rare midnight beasts of the Deep West.
values.use: Beautiful and tough, often carved into jewelry and tools with crystal chisels.

values.name: Joy worms
values.description: Empathic, symbiont worm-like creatures that release endorphins. Popular with many masters.
values.use: Implanted in workers or servitor beasts, they flood the consciousness with pleasure and joy even during odious and boring tasks.

values.name: Karma dust
values.description: Purified extract of the demiurges, so they say. The Inquisition bans karma dust with a vengeance.
values.use: Removes sins, annihilates memories, purifies souls. Foils detection magics and machines.

values.name: Last steel
values.description: Nodules of ever-warm, oily steel from the Long Ago.
values.use: Smiths swear it’s almost alive.

values.name: Livingstone bricks
values.description: Packed in clay, the seeds slowly petrify their surroundings into living stone.
values.use: Petromancers use these to grow stone art, decorations, and furniture.

values.name: Marrow-beet
values.description: Gastropod lichen symbiote, tight in its shell. It can stay alive for months.
values.use: Edible, protein-rich gory chunks in calcinous shells.

values.name: Medimagicals
values.description: Ointments, potions, and implants of all sorts.
values.use: Easier for doctors to fix people with supplies.

values.name: Mounts
values.description: Horses, trail birds, or whatever they breed here.
values.use: They carry stuff. And themselves!

values.name: Odd fruits
values.description: Luminescent vavilov velvets and Cherenkov cherries, prized and delicate.
values.use: Delicious. Fresh may be more valuable.

values.name: Radiothermal fuel
values.description: Poisonous rods to feed into radiothermal barrels.
values.use: Food for the archaic power making machines.

values.name: Rainbow silks
values.description: Shifting colours woven from the silky strands of crystal spiders by the Spectrum Satraps.
values.use: Great for colour-shifting clothes. Or camouflage.

values.name: Rare drugs
values.description: Rare and illegal intoxicants like black light lotus, cat snip, dog’s tail, and whiskers.
values.use: Powerful, but strongly addictive. Sources must be discovered outside of destinations.

values.name: Replacement bodies
values.description: Fine, compliant bodies—perfect for biomancy.
values.use: Ordinary slaves can be as little as €200.

values.name: Saffron
values.description: Mind-altering spice made from the Yellow Land saffron plants. More valuable out West.
values.use: Improves cognition and boosts reflexes.

values.name: Sanguine porcelains
values.description: Mined from the deposits of older times. Unknown if still manufactured anywhere.
values.use: Prized as a pigment or for carving.

values.name: Silver
values.description: And other similar precious metals. Copper wires, vanadium nuts, chromium knives.
values.use: Useful for alchemists and golemancers.

values.name: Soul-stones
values.description: Highly illegal animantic containers charged with distilled spirit.
values.use: Can be used for storing souls and soles.

values.name: Ultra jay needles
values.description: Rare drug from the crystal feathers of a UV bird.
values.use: Used as status symbol in Rainbowlands.

values.name: Vampire wines
values.description: Rich and ruby red, revitalizing for they grow from source-rich soils infused with the flesh of creation.
values.use: More valuable further West.

values.name: Vidy crystals
values.description: Ancient orbs laced with eminently forgettable tales of comedy and tragedy.
values.use: Mass entertainment.Harvested from ancient ruins. Great rewatch value!

values.name: Weapons and armors
values.description: Restricted military-grade equipment.
values.use: Enough to armor and arm three elite troops.
